result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth T Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kenneth T Lewis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kenneth T Lewis was found guilty of Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, costs, surcharges and disbursements.  To be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balances to be paid while on Extended supervision.  Faiure to pay amounts in fulll would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
No contact with any gangs or to be involved in gang activity.  No contact with Marquis L., Takeyra J. or Tiora W. either directly or by third parties.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED.  Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.
Undergo a mental health evaluation. Follow any treatment recommended.

Continue no contact with Marquis L, Takeyra J. or Tiora W. personally or by third party contact.
No gang involvement or activity.
No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician.
No alcohol.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
The  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor; further advised of voting ineligibility.

Per order dated October 14, 2021, Appeal No. 2015XX1459-CR (2015CF395, 2015CF400 and 2015CF2411), IT IS ORDERED that the motions filed by Attorney Tempska to reinstate and extend Lewis's appellate deadlines are denied.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion filed by Attorney Muller to extend Lewis's appellate deadlines is denied.

State Public Defender Report
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, calendar successor, for review. mag
Motion to Withdraw as Appointed Postconviction Counsel

Per order dated October 1, 2021, Appeal No. 2015XX1459-CR (2015CF395, 2015CF400, 2015CF2411), IT IS ORDERED that the motion to withdraw filed by Attorney Tempska is denied without prejudice.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, within fifteen days after the date of this order, the State shall file a response to the motion to reinstate and extend appellate deadlines filed by Attorney Tempska on September 24, 2021.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion filed by Attorney Muller is held in abeyance pending further order of this court.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Kenneth T Lewis not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived his client's appearance.  Defendant is to be sentenced on his case 15CF400; parties attempting a global resolution.  Should this case resolve, parties request to be heard on the next date with defendant's lower-pending case.  So ordered by the Court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Kenneth T Lewis not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Scheduling conference.  Appearance of the defendant waived for the purpose of todays hearing.  Defendant has new case scheduled to be heard in preliminary hearing court on 7-02-15; defense request for adjournment granted.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE FACILITY FOR PURPOSES OF THE SCHEDULING CONFERENCE IN BRANCH 20.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, Defendant Kenneth T Lewis not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's Jury Instructions

Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Parties stipulate to a $1,000.00 signature bond on this case only.  Court ordered TOT to Justice Point: no alcohol or drugs; no firearms or weapons.  All other conditions of bail continue.

Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case was scheduled for speedy jury trial on today's date; State requested an adjournment.  Defense does not object but wishes to address bail.  Court granted State's motion and ordered case adjourned for scheduling to be heard after trial scheduled for 5/11/15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  File retained in court.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Kenneth T Lewis not in court, in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counel waived his client's appearance.  Final pretrial held.  Court denied State's motion to use DNA evidence as it was not filed within the statutory time period. State indicated it would ask for an adjournment at the next court date.  Issues to be addressed at that time.  File retained. Court ordered case continued before Branch 20 on 5/06/15 at 8:30 a.m.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Kenneth T Lewis not in court, in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived his client's appearance for purposes of this hearing.  Final pretrial held. Court ordered any defense motion(s) to be filed by 4/27/15; State's response due by 4/30/15; e-mail copies will be accepted.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing and final pretrial before Branch 20; defendant is to be produced.  File retained in court.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

State's Motion in Limine received and filed with court.

Notice of State's Intent to Use DNA Evidence.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Case must be tried on or before:  5/19/15.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Kenneth T Lewis not in court, in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel waives his client's appearance.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Court set the following filing schedule: movant to file any motions by 3/16/15; response due by 3/26/15; reply due by 3/31/15.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are due within one (1) week of the final pretrial date; any alibi notices must be filed per statute.  State to turn over additional discovery requested by defense counsel.  Court ordered case also set for status to ensure all discovery was received.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
This case should be ressigned to branch 20 with the defendants other case. sab

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
